column4: Why is it that .WAV files are refusing to play in Audacious under Gutsy? I have the wav plugin installed and enabled, but it will not play them
Can you play the wav file in something like rythymbox
Yes, I can
That tells me its just an audacious problem.
I've tried reinstalling it and disabling/re-enabling the plugin to no avail

I see other people are having a similar problem. I'll keep looking into it. In the meantime this link suggests that switching to OSS might solve the problem. http://boards.nenolod.net/viewtopic.php?f=8&p=2792
Won't OSS cause issues with sharing the audio device though?
Yes, it probably will. But it may help us narrow down the problem further, and it should be reversible. So it is worth doing just as a test if you like.
I just changed it to OSS and it still will not play
ok. Thanks for that info. I'm still looking into it.
Okay, thank you
Did you also change your audio settings in addition to your audacious settings? Your audio is probably set to default, but what if it were set to OSS?
I just changed my system audio to OSS and it still won't work
When your done that, switch it back to the original state. Whether it works or not.
Ok, see above.
Okay, I'm back to my original settings. Could it be an issue with the WAV plugin?
I don't think so... I'm only 20% sure of that though. You say you can't play it, are you opening the file from within audacious, or just clicking on it through thunar?

I've tried both. When I try to click on the file, I receive an "Open File" window despite the file being set to open with Audacious. If I try to add it directly to Audacious by dragging it into the playlist, it won't add it
Wait a second, if I go to Audacious and click Add, and then add the file that way, it will add to the playlist and is able to be played
Ok. I'd read about someone else having that same issue. Very odd. Seems like a bug to me.
I can't find a bug report on this issue.
So is this an isolated incident then?
Today is your lucky day :)
I'm seeing that :)
